answers.answer: Have you consulted a doctor and had a blood plasma reading and an actual glucose test?That should be your first step.  You sound pretty darn healthy to me!Hope all goes well....

question: My problem: my blood sugar was 126  4 months ago.  Last week it was 120 and my fasting glucose was 5.5.  My mother had type 2 diabetes as did my paternal grandmother.  I believe that's it for my family.  I am surprised and saddened by this diagnosis since I work pretty hard at eating and behaving well.  Any advice or ideas as to what's going on? I am a 65 year old 62 inch, 122 lb. woman who has been a quasi vegetarian for 25 years, I do not smoke, eat junk food or fast food of any kind, ever.  My cholesterol is low, my blood pressure fine, my spirits good.  I don't think I have any real stress in my life.  I drink wine, tea, and eat dark chocolate, cheese (maybe too much of this), whole grains, lots of vegetables, eggs and fish. all of which I would hate to give up but will if necessary.  I walk a minimum of 4 to 5 miles daly at 4 mph, (ex-runner) do yoga 2 times a week and lift weights 2-3 times a week. What now?Thanks
title: what to do now?
